translation: (1) The Most Merciful
(2) Taught the Qur’ān,
(3) Created man,
(4) [And] taught him eloquence.
(5) The sun and the moon [move] by precise calculation,
(6) And the stars and trees prostrate.[1593]
footnotes: [1593]- They submit obediently to the laws of Allāh.  See 22:18.  An additional meaning of "najm" is vegetation of a kind without a trunk, stalk or stem.

translation: (7) And the heaven He raised and imposed the balance
(8) That you not transgress within the balance.

arabic_text: وَأَقِيمُواْ ٱلۡوَزۡنَ بِٱلۡقِسۡطِ وَلَا تُخۡسِرُواْ ٱلۡمِيزَانَ
translation: (9) And establish weight in justice and do not make deficient the balance.
(10) And the earth He laid [out] for the creatures.
(11) Therein is fruit and palm trees having sheaths [of dates]
(12) And grain having husks and scented plants.
(13) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?[1594]
footnotes: [1594]- Literally, "you two," addressing the species of mankind and jinn.

translation: (14) He created man from clay like [that of] pottery.

arabic_text: وَخَلَقَ ٱلۡجَآنَّ مِن مَّارِجٖ مِّن نَّارٖ
translation: (15) And He created the jinn from a smokeless flame of fire.
(16) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
(17) [He is] Lord of the two sunrises and Lord of the two sunsets.[1595]
footnotes: [1595]- i.e., the points of sunrise in the east and sunset in the west in both summer and winter.

translation: (18) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
(19) He released the two seas,[1596] meeting [one another];
footnotes: [1596]- Two bodies of water or two sea waters of distinct characteristics.

translation: (20) Between them is a barrier so neither of them transgresses.
(21) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
(22) From both of them emerge pearl and coral.
(23) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

arabic_text: وَلَهُ ٱلۡجَوَارِ ٱلۡمُنشَـَٔاتُ فِي ٱلۡبَحۡرِ كَٱلۡأَعۡلَٰمِ
translation: (24) And to Him belong the ships [with sails] elevated in the sea like mountains.
(25) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
(26) Everyone upon it [i.e., the earth] will perish,

arabic_text: وَيَبۡقَىٰ وَجۡهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو ٱلۡجَلَٰلِ وَٱلۡإِكۡرَامِ
translation: (27) And there will remain the Face[1597] of your Lord, Owner of Majesty and Honor.
(28) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

arabic_text: يَسۡـَٔلُهُۥ مَن فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ كُلَّ يَوۡمٍ هُوَ فِي شَأۡنٖ
translation: (29) Whoever is within the heavens and earth asks Him; every day He is in [i.e., bringing about] a matter.[1598]
(30) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
(31) We will attend to you, O prominent beings.[1599]
(32) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

arabic_text: يَٰمَعۡشَرَ ٱلۡجِنِّ وَٱلۡإِنسِ إِنِ ٱسۡتَطَعۡتُمۡ أَن تَنفُذُواْ مِنۡ أَقۡطَارِ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ فَٱنفُذُواْۚ لَا تَنفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ
translation: (33) O company of jinn and mankind, if you are able to pass beyond the regions of the heavens and the earth, then pass. You will not pass except by authority [from Allāh].
(34) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

arabic_text: يُرۡسَلُ عَلَيۡكُمَا شُوَاظٞ مِّن نَّارٖ وَنُحَاسٞ فَلَا تَنتَصِرَانِ
translation: (35) There will be sent upon you a flame of fire and smoke,[1600] and you will not defend yourselves.
footnotes: [1600]- Another possible meaning is liquefied brass or copper.

translation: (36) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

arabic_text: فَإِذَا ٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَكَانَتۡ وَرۡدَةٗ كَٱلدِّهَانِ
translation: (37) And when the heaven is split open and becomes rose-colored like oil[1601] -
(38) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

arabic_text: فَيَوۡمَئِذٖ لَّا يُسۡـَٔلُ عَن ذَنۢبِهِۦٓ إِنسٞ وَلَا جَآنّٞ
translation: (39) Then on that Day none will be asked about his sin among men or jinn.[1602]
footnotes: [1602]- Once they have been condemned to the Fire.

translation: (40) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

arabic_text: يُعۡرَفُ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ بِسِيمَٰهُمۡ فَيُؤۡخَذُ بِٱلنَّوَٰصِي وَٱلۡأَقۡدَامِ
translation: (41) The criminals will be known by their marks, and they will be seized by the forelocks and the feet.
(42) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

arabic_text: هَٰذِهِۦ جَهَنَّمُ ٱلَّتِي يُكَذِّبُ بِهَا ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ
translation: (43) This is Hell, which the criminals deny.
(44) They will circulate between it and scalding water, heated [to the utmost degree].
(45) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
(46) But for he who has feared the position of his Lord[1603] are two gardens -
footnotes: [1603]- An alternative meaning is "the standing [for account] before his Lord."

translation: (47) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
(48) Having [spreading] branches.
(49) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
(50) In both of them are two springs, flowing.
(51) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
(52) In both of them are of every fruit, two kinds.
(53) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

arabic_text: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ فُرُشِۭ بَطَآئِنُهَا مِنۡ إِسۡتَبۡرَقٖۚ وَجَنَى ٱلۡجَنَّتَيۡنِ دَانٖ
translation: (54) [They are] reclining on beds whose linings are of silk brocade, and the fruit of the two gardens is hanging low.
(55) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

arabic_text: فِيهِنَّ قَٰصِرَٰتُ ٱلطَّرۡفِ لَمۡ يَطۡمِثۡهُنَّ إِنسٞ قَبۡلَهُمۡ وَلَا جَآنّٞ
translation: (56) In them are women limiting [their] glances,[1604] untouched[1605] before them by man or jinnī -
footnotes: [1604]- To their own mates, i.e., being chaste and modest. [1605]- Literally, they have not been caused to bleed by loss of virginity.

translation: (57) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
(58) As if they were rubies and coral.[1606]
(59) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
(60) Is the reward for good [anything] but good?
(61) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
(62) And below them both [in excellence] are two [other] gardens -
(63) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
(64) Dark green [in color].
(65) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
(66) In both of them are two springs, spouting.
(67) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
(68) In both of them are fruit and palm trees and pomegranates.
(69) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
(70) In them are good and beautiful women -
(71) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
(72) Fair ones reserved in pavilions -
(73) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

arabic_text: لَمۡ يَطۡمِثۡهُنَّ إِنسٞ قَبۡلَهُمۡ وَلَا جَآنّٞ
translation: (74) Untouched before them by man or jinnī -
(75) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

arabic_text: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ رَفۡرَفٍ خُضۡرٖ وَعَبۡقَرِيٍّ حِسَانٖ
translation: (76) Reclining on green cushions and beautiful fine carpets.
(77) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

arabic_text: تَبَٰرَكَ ٱسۡمُ رَبِّكَ ذِي ٱلۡجَلَٰلِ وَٱلۡإِكۡرَامِ
translation: (78) Blessed is the name of your Lord, Owner of Majesty and Honor.
